history.text: So despicable me has been out for about 8 years now.
Has some amazing ratings, cinemascore A, metacritic 72/100, rottom tomatoes 81%, Steve Carell is my favorite.
wow, time flies, I can't believe it's been 8 years
Interesting that the title is based on how Steve Carell, aka Gru, refers to himself in the show. Critics think it is a good movie for kids and adults.
I didn't know that about the tite, either
most animated movies nowadays can be appreciated by adults as well
after all, parents have to sit through the movie with their kids as well
I know, I enjoy how the movie is described as short, sweet and sour and amusing.
I didn't realize it was a French animation company
I did not realize that either, that is a fun fact to share
The director Pierre Coffin did an excellent job collabing with chris renaud
it seems some of the critics were taking a jab at it, with their comments on how Pixar is "inspiring the midlist"
Sometimes critics can be blinded, I wish they would try to understand more first
what do you mean?
do you feel the critics reviewed the movie unfairly?
Understand that this is a flip on normal movies, usually villians take over but they did the opposite, they had the villian be the star
from the description it doesn't sound like the villian follows a different story trajectory than most heroes in other movies
he has a mission. he has a challenge to overcome, he has a rival. the only thing is he is on the "bad guy's" side from the beginning
That is true as well. All in all it was an animation I can enjoy, animation is one of my favorite generes
I think one of the more interesting parts was when the pyramid of giza got stolen
that was the part that set it all off, no?
indeed it was, it then prompte gru to steal the moon
funny how the villian who stole the pyramid ended up being the son of the man at the Bank of Evil
do you think backing a loan to another villian qualifies as a "conflict of interest" for him?
I do believe it would. I felt so sad when the day of the moon stealing conflicted with the ballet recital
I know, what will Gru do?
It says he rushes back but the girls have been kidnapped, what a heart racing turn of events!
yeah, he should have been there to protect the girls
it looks like he gets them back though
and Vector gets trapped on the moon
i do agree, i wish he learned his lesson first
how funny
Gru seems pretty sweet for a supervillian
i think he may be misunderstood, i think he is someone i could befriend
do you think his part in the story follows that of the traditional hero?

uid2response.feedback: If I was talking to a real person the conversation seemed very odd. If it was a machine though, the conversation went well.
